article.Heading: Budget 2016: Here's a wishlist from the start-up community
article.Summary: CNBC-TV18 caught up with some of the most successful start-up entrepreneursâ€™ and investors on the sidelines of the Surge Summit in Bangaluru to find out what they wanted from the Budget.
article.Body:
India's been trying hard to built its own Silicon Valley in the country, and the Start-Up India program has been lauded by one and all.

However, that doesn't mean that the start-up industry has no wishlist for the finance minister from the Union Budget. CNBC-TV18 caught up with some of the most successful start-up entrepreneurs’ and investors on the sidelines of the Surge Summit in Bangaluru to find out what they wanted from the Budget.

Shashank ND, Founder & MD, Practo said there was need to incentivize the medical industry,while Karthik Reddy, Managing Partner, Blume Ventures said there was need for domestic investors to become more bullish on start-ups. He also wished for a tax friendly regime. 

According to him setting up a start-up was a difficult process and hoped the government would make the process easier.
